title: HTML Style Guide
gp1: A consistent, clean, and tidy HTML code makes it easier for others to read and understand your code.
gp2: Here are some guidelines and tips for creating good HTML code.
gp3: Always declare the document type as the first line in your document.
gp4: The correct document type for HTML is: <!DOCTYPE html>
gp5: HTML allows mixing uppercase and lowercase letters in element names.

wp1: Always specify the alt attribute for images. This attribute is important if the image for some reason cannot be displayed.
wp2: Also, always define the width and height of images. This reduces flickering, because the browser can reserve space for the image before loading.
wp3: HTML allows spaces around equal signs. But space-less is easier to read and groups entities better together.
wp4: When using an HTML editor, it is NOT convenient to scroll right and left to read the HTML code.
wp5: The viewport is the user's visible area of a web page. It varies with the device - it will be smaller on a mobile phone than on a computer screen.
wp6: To ensure proper interpretation and correct search engine indexing, both the language and the character encoding <meta charset='charset'> should be defined as early as possible in an HTML document:
